IMUSim
Package imusim :: Package trajectories :: Module rigid_body

Source Code for Module imusim.trajectories.rigid_body

  1  """ 
  2  Modelling of rigid body models for motion trajectory generation. 
  3   
  4  Rigid body models are composed of a tree of L{Joint} objects. Each Joint has 
  5  an offset from its parent, specified in the parents local co-ordinate frame. 
  6  The position of any part of the body model can be calculated using forward 
  7  kinematics, given the position of the root joint of the body model and the 
  8  rotation of each of the joints. 
  9   
 10  The rotation of joints is given by a L{RotationTrajectory} specifying the 
 11  rotation of the joint local co-ordinate frame relative to the global 
 12  co-ordinate frame at any point in time. The position of the root joint of 
 13  the body model is specified by a L{PositionTrajectory}. 
 14  """ 
 15  # Copyright (C) 2009-2011 University of Edinburgh 
 16  # 
 17  # This file is part of IMUSim. 
 18  # 
 19  # IMUSim is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it 
 20  # under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by 
 21  # the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or 
 22  # (at your option) any later version. 
 23  # 
 24  # IMUSim is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, 
 25  # but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of 
 26  # MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the 
 27  # GNU General Public License for more details. 
 28  # 
 29  # You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License 
 30  # along with IMUSim.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>. 
 31   
 32  from imusim.trajectories.offset import OffsetTrajectory 
 33  from imusim.trajectories.sampled import SampledPositionTrajectory 
 34  from imusim.trajectories.sampled import SampledRotationTrajectory 
 35  from imusim.trajectories.splined import SplinedPositionTrajectory 
 36  from imusim.trajectories.splined import SplinedRotationTrajectory 
 37  from imusim.utilities.trees import TreeNode 
 38  import numpy as np

 40 -class Point(TreeNode): 

 41      """ 
 42      A point in a rigid body model. 
 43   
 44      @ivar name: Name of this point. 
 45      @ivar parent: The parent L{Joint} in the body model hierarchy. 
 46      @ivar positionOffset: Position offset of this point from its parent in the 
 47          parent's local co-ordinate frame, or the global frame if no parent. 
 48      """ 
 49   

 50 -    def __init__(self, parent, name=None, offset=None): 

 51          """ 
 52          Construct a point. 
 53   
 54          @param parent: Parent L{Joint}, or None for a point in the global 
 55              co-ordinate frame. 
 56          @param name: Name of this point. 
 57          @param offset: Offset of this point in the co-ordinate frame of its 
 58              parent, as a 3x1 L{np.ndarray}. Default is zero offset. 
 59          """ 
 60          TreeNode.__init__(self, parent) 
 61          assert isinstance(self, Joint) or isinstance(parent, Joint) 
 62          self.positionOffset = np.zeros((3,1)) if offset is None else offset 
 63          self.name = name 

 64   
 65      @property 

 66 -    def isJoint(self): 

 67          """ 
 68          Whether this point is a joint that can rotate. 
 69          """ 
 70          return isinstance(self, Joint) 

 71

 73      """ 
 74      A joint in a rigid body model, with its own rotating co-ordinate frame. 
 75   
 76      @ivar children: List of child points that have this joint as parent. 
 77      """

 79 -    def __init__(self, parent, name=None, offset=None):

 81          Construct a joint.

 85          @param offset: Offset of this joint in the co-ordinate frame of its 
 86              parent, as a 3x1 L{np.ndarray}. Default is zero offset. 
 87          """ 
 88          Point.__init__(self, parent, name, offset) 
 89          self.children = []

 92 -    def points(self): 

 93          """ 
 94          Iterator for the points of the body model starting at this point. 
 95   
 96          @see: L{preorderTraversal}

 98          return self.preorderTraversal()

101 -    def pointNames(self): 

102          """

106   

107 -    def getPoint(self, pointName): 

108          """ 
109          Get a point by name from the point tree rooted at this point. 
110   
111          @param pointName: The name of the point to return (string). 
112          @return: The corresponding L{Point} object. 
113          @raises KeyError: If the named point is not present in the subtree. 
114          """ 
115          for p in self.points: 
116              if p.name == pointName: 
117                  return p 
118          raise KeyError 

119   
120      @property 

121 -    def childJoints(self): 

122          """ 
123          List of child joints that have this joint as parent. 
124          """ 
125          return filter(lambda p: p.isJoint, self.children) 

126   
127      @property 

128 -    def hasChildJoints(self): 

129          """ 
130          Whether this joint has any child joints. 
131          """ 
132          return len(self.childJoints) != 0 

133   
134      @property 

135 -    def joints(self): 

136          """ 
137          Iterator for the joints of the body model starting at this joint. 
138          """ 
139          return self.preorderTraversal(condition=lambda p: p.isJoint) 

140   
141      @property 

142 -    def jointNames(self): 

143          """

146          return [j.name for j in self.joints] 

147   

148 -    def getJoint(self, jointName): 

149          """ 
150          Get a joint by name from the subtree rooted at this joint. 
151   
152          @param jointName: The name of the joint to return (string). 
153          @return: The corresponding L{Joint} object. 
154          @raises KeyError: If the named joint is not present in the subtree. 
155          """ 
156          for p in self.joints: 
157              if p.name == jointName: 
158                  return p 
159          raise KeyError 

160   
161      @classmethod 

162 -    def structureCopy(cls, ref, parent=None): 

163          """ 
164          Create a deep copy of the body model tree starting from the given joint. 
165          """ 
166          joint = cls(parent, ref.name, ref.positionOffset) 
167          for child in ref.children: 
168              if child.isJoint: 
169                  cls.structureCopy(child, joint) 
170              else: 
171                  Point(joint, child.name, child.positionOffset) 
172          return joint

239 -class SplinedJoint(SplinedRotationTrajectory, OffsetTrajectory, Joint):

242 -    def __init__(self, parent, sampled, **kwargs):

253          self.children = [ 
254                  (SplinedJoint(self, child, **kwargs) if child.isJoint
